result.execSummary:
The defendant Traevon L Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Traevon L Patterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 
Janice L. and Linda P.

As to Count 1:
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine in the amount of: $200.00.  This is due by 01/29/2016.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 01/29/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).


Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.   Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Branch 22 has agreed to accept this case for global resolution with a pending felony case on July 29, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and status conference  in Branch 22. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court does not object to taking this case for global resolution with case# 15CF1843, plea and sentencing on 07/29/2015 at 1:30pm./

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has picked up a new case.   Court vacates the stayed warrant.  State rescends their DPA.  Case to be transferred back to the trial court.  

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court, defendant Traevon L Patterson not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense attorney informs the court the defendant has pending charges and is currently in custody. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Court adjourned case for Initial Appearance to branch 6.
  Initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 4-27-2015 at 8:30am
